title: Kinda wish we had a RoD for tanks.
body:
I know that you can build {{item:3027}} on tanks and that it offers stats that are great (AP, health, mana.  More of an AP bruiser item honestly).  But I wish we had a tank item that would get stronger has the game progresses in the same way.  Giving us more armor and MR the more time goes by.

Just a thought.

Not sure what scaling items really offer. Looking at RoA and Arch angle staff, they don't really offer better stats than other items when fully stacked, so it's not a late game item. however, they are usually early game purchases, and have a comparitively lower cost. 

So scaling items as such would likely offer a mid game power spike. Is that a powercurve a Tank will want? would it be oppressive if tanks had such a power curve?

Not taking into account rabba passive, archangel easily gives the most ap an item you can ever get on any mana champion.
And a powerful active too. That shield is a huge deal when you fight Assassins/Burst Mages.

RoA mostly offers a myriad of stats at the same time that all appeal to mages and fit their natural power curve, while also being very gold efficient late game.

Tank itemization is suited to having a strong mid game and being terrible early/late and also being gold inefficient, I don't think Riot would want an item that completely shifts that dynamic

There's only two items in the game that give both armor and MR. Neither of them also give health.

It's too much slot efficiency.

1.  What's to keep non-tanks like fizz or echo from abusing it?
2.  Tank stats are multiplicative, so what's to keep it good enough to buy, but not unbalanced?
3.  You could argue that the point of ROA is delaying your powerspike for a group of champions that are pretty strong.  What are the best reasons for slow down a tank's tankiness?

1. You can ask this for every tank item ever made, champions building tanky build every tank item that's useful to them. It's not the fault of the items or a reason against creating them.
2. Not sure about this. Everyone's stats are multiplicative but maybe it's not a good idea to put % amps on every stat a class buys.
3. I guess if you were doing well enough that you wanted to mke sure you didn't fall off? I dunno.

1. The same things that are ment to keep them from abuseing any tankitem ever? Either they have to much damage from non items and can afford tank items, or they give up enough damage for it to be balanced. Also, both ekko and fizz want an early powerspike from their first item rather than delayed power, which is also why you rarly see bruiserbuilts with roa on them.
2. Only an issue if it provides both multiplicative parts(resi+health), or if the overall cost efficiency, especially in the early, is to good.
3. Tankiness currently spikes early/mid, and gets kinda obsolete later on.
A strong scaleing tank item might provide a way to escape that set in stone powercurve.

1. Nothing. Just like now there is little that tank items can do to prevent abuse from other classes. 

That's all I got.
